problem.markdown:
1. For 1 cm gap in air at 760 mm pressure and 200C temperature the Break Down Voltage is
( ) 14 kV (x) 30.3 kV ( ) 22.92 kV ( ) 40 kV
2. Sphere gaps are used to measure
( ) DC Voltages ( ) AC Voltages (x) DC, AC peak and impulse voltages ( ) Only DC and AC peak voltage
3. Sphere gap BDV measurement is linear and valid for gap spacing less than
(x) the Radius of sphere ( ) the diameter of sphere ( ) Half the radius of sphere ( ) Two times the diameter of sphere
4. In volt-time characteristics, the breakdown voltage for a negative impulse is______the positive impulse.
( ) Less Than (x) Greater Than ( ) Equal To ( ) None of these
5. The main factors that affect the spark over voltage of sphere gap are
( ) Humidity and waveform (x) Nearby earthed objects and atmospheric conditions ( ) Diameter of sphere ( ) Gap spacing, diameter and waveform
6. Impulse ratio of a rod gap
( ) Unity (x) Between 1.2 and 1.5 ( ) Between 1.6 and 1.8 ( ) Between 2 and 2.2
7. which electrode has minimum breakdown voltage
( ) Sphere electrode (x) Pointed electrode ( ) Flat Electrode ( ) Big sphere electrode
8. The insulation of the modern EHV lines is designed based on
( ) The lightning voltage (x) The switching voltage ( ) Corona ( ) RI
9. Minimum sparking potential of Air is about
( ) 100 V ( ) 4.4 kV ( ) 40 V (x) 325 V
10. Electrostatic voltmeter can measure
( ) Only DC voltages (x) Both DC and AC voltages upto high frequency ( ) Impulse voltages ( ) Only DC and AC peak voltages
